content.description: Begin on the right below the second lowest roof. Claw up left past the roof to a face below the higher roof. Exit left or right, depending on where you dropped your anchors.

Stay to the left of the quartz vein, holds on the vein are off. Made it to the roof section but was unable to figure out how to reach the good hold at the top of the roof. You could use holds on the quartz vein but I think its possible to do it without. Maybe someone better could figure it out. Video Beta of my attempts: youtube.com/watch?v=pKA9aJA…
content.protection: Trees at top can be used as a natural anchor.
content.location: Start on good holds approx shoulder height. The route is left of Being Short Is No Joke to the left of the Big Roof Wall.

content.description: Just left of the Big Roof is a short wall with a beautiful splitter hand crack. Despite the short length this slightly overhanging crack packs a punch and is worth taking a lap on. It was originally lead on two pieces of gear.
content.location: Red route on the beta photo.

content.description: This route climbs the short, right-facing corner on the left side of the Big Roof outcrop. Work up the short face through an awkward move or two to a stance. Get onto the right-facing corner and send it to a small overhang above. Reach up to a good hold on the outside corner to finish.
content.protection: Tree anchors at top. Bring anchors from 30-40 feet in length.

content.description: The Big Roof Wall is just uphill and East of the Pinnacle. While it is not very high it has several large overhangs.
